meanings.sent1: The wind made the day feel the iciest it had ever been.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream was at its iciest point, perfect for a hot summer day.
meanings.sent3: She gave him the iciest stare when he forgot their anniversary.
meanings.sent4: The iciest glare from the teacher silenced the noisy classroom instantly.
meanings.sent5: The iciest water I've ever felt numbed my fingers in seconds.

meanings.sent1: His iciest response to her question hurt her feelings.
meanings.sent2: The room had an icy atmosphere, making it feel the iciest place on earth.
meanings.sent3: Despite his jokes, his eyes remained the iciest in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her iciest goodbye left him feeling alone and abandoned.
meanings.sent5: The iciest reception greeted her when she arrived at the party.

meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of ice
meanings.sent1: The mountain peak was the iciest part of the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The iciest roads in town were treacherous to drive on.
meanings.sent3: The iciest patches on the lake made it dangerous for skating.
meanings.sent4: The iciest sculptures at the ice festival sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The iciest layer of frost coated the window, blocking the view outside.
